meanings.definition: To fill or permeate with a quality or emotion.
meanings.sent1: She was infusing her artwork with passion and creativity.
meanings.sent2: The music was infusing the room with joy and energy.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't help but smile, feeling the happiness infusing his heart.
meanings.sent4: The laughter of children was infusing the playground with life.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of fresh flowers infusing the air made her feel peaceful.

meanings.definition: To introduce into the mind or feelings.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was infusing knowledge into the young minds.
meanings.sent2: Reading fairy tales can infuse a sense of wonder into children.
meanings.sent3: His jokes were infusing humor into the conversation.
meanings.sent4: The movie was infusing fear into the audience with its suspenseful scenes.
meanings.sent5: The motivational speaker was infusing confidence into the crowd.

meanings.definition: To steep or soak in a liquid to extract flavor or strength.
meanings.sent1: She was infusing the tea with herbs to make a soothing drink.
meanings.sent2: The chef was infusing the broth with spices for a rich flavor.
meanings.sent3: The sponge was infusing with water, ready to clean the dishes.
meanings.sent4: The meat was infusing in the marinade, becoming more flavorful.
meanings.sent5: The fabric was infusing in the dye, turning a vibrant color.
